p: Fingolimod is mainly contra-indicated in patients with myocardial infarction (within six months), unstable angina, stroke, heart failure, and heart block. Prolonged QT interval above 500 m/s is another important contra-indication, given the high incidence of myocarditis as a complication of severe COVID-19. Patients with diabetes may get macular edema upon fingolimod treatment [ 100]. A clinical trial has been registered to use fingolimod at a dose of 0.5 mg daily for three consecutive days in the treatment of severe COVID-19 infection (NCT04280588).
